Hamburg High School teacher Lori Raybold received the Toby Ticktin Back Education and Excellence Award from the Holocaust Resource Center of Buffalo (HRC) in a recent surprise virtual ceremony. Named after the HRC’s founder, the award is given annually to an outstanding educator who has dedicated time and energy to teaching the Holocaust and other human rights issues both inside and outside of the classroom.
.
Ms. Raybold has taught the Holocaust and other human rights issues throughout the past 17 years as an English Language Arts educator at Hamburg. She also took the initiative to start the elective “Human Rights Literature.”

About 50 people participated in the Zoom award celebration.

post_text: The Hamburg High School Academy of Finance will hold an Information Night on Wednesday, Feb. 26 at 6 p.m. in the LMC for freshmen and parents. The presentation will focus on how this three-year career & college readiness program can help ensure that students are "future ready" upon graduation. Topics will include required academy courses, college credit opportunities, work-based learning experiences within the program, academy-exclusive professional development for students, community service, paid internships, support from the AOF industry advisory board including the new mentor program and credentials that students have the opportunity to graduate with. Freshman year is the only time students can apply to the Hamburg AOF program and applications are due March 27. For more information, e-mail klawrence@hcsdk12.org or visit https://hhs.hamburgschools.org/students/activities/academy_of_finance

The homemade scones were provided by Joyce Bigelow, who substituted for Mrs. Nowak during her illness.

Our thoughts and prayers are with Logan and his family, and we will continue to do all we can to provide support to our school community.
